channel.title: CVE Feed for Unknown -- WP JobSearch
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Unknown -- WP JobSearch

item.title: CVE-2021-24421|2024-08-03T19:28:24.004Z -- unknown -- wp%20jobsearch
item.description: The WP JobSearch WordPress plugin before 1.7.4 did not sanitise or escape multiple of its parameters from the my-resume page before outputting them in the page, allowing low privilege users to use JavaScript payloads in them and leading to a Stored Cross-Site Scripting issue

item.title: CVE-2023-6584|2024-07-25T16:03:39.160Z -- unknown -- wp%20jobsearch
item.description: The WP JobSearch WordPress plugin before 2.3.4 does not prevent attackers from logging-in as any users with the only knowledge of that user's email address.

item.title: CVE-2023-6585|2024-02-27T08:30:25.818Z -- unknown -- wp%20jobsearch
item.description: The WP JobSearch WordPress plugin before 2.3.4 does not validate files to be uploaded, which could allow unauthenticated attackers to upload arbitrary files such as PHP on the server

item.title: CVE-2023-6584|2024-02-27T08:30:26.628Z -- unknown -- wp%20jobsearch
item.description: The WP JobSearch WordPress plugin before 2.3.4 does not prevent attackers from logging-in as any users with the only knowledge of that user's email address.

item.title: CVE-2023-6585|2024-08-02T08:35:14.606Z -- unknown -- wp%20jobsearch
item.description: The WP JobSearch WordPress plugin before 2.3.4 does not validate files to be uploaded, which could allow unauthenticated attackers to upload arbitrary files such as PHP on the server

item.title: CVE-2023-6584|2024-08-02T08:35:14.824Z -- unknown -- wp%20jobsearch
item.description: The WP JobSearch WordPress plugin before 2.3.4 does not prevent attackers from logging-in as any users with the only knowledge of that user's email address.
